sen.j: 西向日駅（にしむこうえき）は、京都府向日市にある、阪急電鉄阪急京都本線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Muko City, Kyoto Prefecture, Nishimuko Station is a stop on the Hankyu Kyoto Line, which is operated by the Hankyu Railway.
Nishimuko Station, located in Muko City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Hankyu Kyoto Line, which is operated by the Hankyu Railway.
Nishimuko Station, located in Muko City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Hankyu Kyoto Line, which is operated by the Hankyu Railway.

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Station layout
The station's structure
Station layout

sen.j: プラットホーム形状と配置2面2線を有する地上駅。
sen.e: Nishimuko Station is an aboveground station with two platforms serving two tracks (the form of platform and its arrangement).
Nishimuko Station is an aboveground station with two platforms serving two tracks.
Nishimuko Station is an aboveground station with two platforms serving two tracks.

sen.j: のりば番号は設定されていない。
sen.e: Track numbers are not assigned.
Platform numbers aren't assigned.
Platform numbers aren't assigned.

sen.j: 河原町行きホームの大阪より後ろ４両分には屋根が設置されていないため雨のときは要注意である。
sen.e: Since a roof is not installed on the platform for Kawaramachi Station for a length of four cars on the Osaka side, passengers need to be careful when it rains.
Because no roof is provided over the platform for Kawaramachi Station for a length of four cars on the Osaka side, passengers must be careful when it rains.
Because no roof is provided over the platform for Kawaramachi Station for a length of four cars on the Osaka side, passengers must be careful when it rains.

sen.j: 駅舎（改札口）は両ホームの河原町寄りにあり、互いのホームは地下道で連絡している。
sen.e: The station building (ticket gate) is located on the Kawaramachi side of the platforms which are connected by an underground passage.
The station building (ticket gate) is located on the Kawaramachi side of the platforms, which are connected by an underground passage.
The station building (ticket gate) is located on the Kawaramachi side of the platforms, which are connected by an underground passage.

sen.j: 阪急西向日駅には、バス路線は乗り入れていない。
sen.e: There is no bus route entering Hankyu Nishimuko Station.
No bus route enters Hankyu Nishimuko Station.
No bus route enters Hankyu Nishimuko Station.

sen.j: 最寄バス停：阪急バス向日町郵便局前
sen.e: Nearest bus stop: Hankyu Bus Mukomachi post office-mae

sen.j: 利用系統 70系統 向日台団地前・一文橋経由 長岡京駅行き
sen.e: Route 70: for Nagaokakyo Station via Mukodai Danchi-mae and Ichimonbashi

sen.j: 平成15年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約6,520人（京都府統計書より）。
sen.e: The number of passengers per day was about 6,520 in 2003 (adapted from Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Book).
The number of passengers per day was about 6,520 in 2003 (according to the Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Book).
The number of passengers per day was about 6,520 in fiscal year 2003 (according to the Kyoto Prefecture Statistics Report).
sen.cmt: 統一しました。fiscal → fiscal yearに変更しました。

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）11月1日 新京阪鉄道高槻町～西院開通時に西向日町駅（にしむこうまちえき）として開業。
sen.e: On November 1, 1928 the station was opened as Nishimukomachi Station when the section between Takatsuki-cho Station and Saiin Station of the Shinkeihan Railway was opened.
November 1, 1928: the station was opened as Nishimukomachi Station when the section between Takatsuki-cho Station and Saiin Station of the Shinkeihan Railway was opened.
November 1, 1928: the station was opened as Nishimukomachi Station when the section between Takatsuki-cho Station and Saiin Station of the Shinkeihan Railway was opened.

sen.j: 1930年（昭和5年）9月15日 会社合併により京阪電気鉄道新京阪線の駅となる。
sen.e: On September 15, 1930 Nishimukomachi Station became a stop on the Shinkeihan Line operated by the Keihan Electric Railway as a result of amalgamation.
September 15, 1930: Nishimukomachi Station became a stop on the Shinkeihan Line, operated by the Keihan Electric Railway, as a result of amalgamation.
September 15, 1930: Nishimukomachi Station became a stop on the Shinkeihan Line, operated by the Keihan Electric Railway, as a result of amalgamation.

sen.j: 1943年（昭和18年）10月1日 会社合併により京阪神急行電鉄（現在の阪急電鉄）の駅となる。
sen.e: On October 1, 1943 Nishimukomachi Station came to be operated by the Keihanshin Express Railway (the current Hankyu Railway) as a result of amalgamation.
October 1, 1943: Nishimukomachi Station came to be operated by the Keihanshin Express Railway (the current Hankyu Railway) as a result of amalgamation.
October 1, 1943: Nishimukomachi Station came to be operated by the Keihanshin Express Railway (the current Hankyu Railway) as a result of amalgamation.

sen.j: 1972年（昭和47年）10月1日 向日町の市制施行により、西向日駅に改称。
sen.e: On October 1, 1972 the station was renamed Nishimuko Station under the municipality of Mukomachi.
October 1, 1972: the station was renamed Nishimuko Station under the municipality of Mukomachi.
October 1, 1972: the station was renamed Nishimuko Station under the municipality of Mukomachi.

sen.j: 通過
sen.e: (Commuter) Limited Express, Limited Express, and Rapid Express trains do not stop at Nishimuko Station.
(Commuter) limited express, limited express and rapid express trains don't stop at Nishimuko Station.
(Commuter) limited express, limited express and rapid express trains don't stop at Nishimuko Station.

sen.e: Nagaokatenjin Station - Nishimuko Station - Higashimuko Station
Nagaokatenjin Station - Nishimuko Station - Higashimuko Station

sen.j: 幻の延伸計画
sen.e: Unrealized extension plan
Unrealized extension plan
Unrealized extension plan

sen.j: 阪急京都本線を建設した京阪電気鉄道の子会社新京阪鉄道は、この駅から分岐して伏見区・山科区を経由し大津市馬場に至るまでの免許を有していた。
sen.e: Shinkeihan Railway, a subsidiary of the Keihan Electric Railway which constructed the Hankyu Kyoto Line, obtained a license for the line branching off this station to Bamba, Otsu City via Fushimi Ward and Yamashina Ward.

Shinkeihan Railway, a subsidiary of the Keihan Electric Railway, which constructed the Hankyu Kyoto Line, obtained a license for the line branching off this station to Bamba, Otsu City via Fushimi Ward and Yamashina Ward.

Shinkeihan Railway, a subsidiary of the Keihan Electric Railway, which constructed the Hankyu Kyoto Line, obtained a license for the line branching off this station to Banba, Otsu City via Fushimi Ward and Yamashina Ward.

sen.j: 京阪では、更にそこから名古屋市までの高速電気鉄道線を建設する名古屋急行電鉄の構想を持っており、1929年には免許を収得した。
sen.e: The Keihan Electric Railway had a plan to construct Nagoya Express Railway, a high-speed railway leading further to Nagoya City, and obtained a license in 1929.
The Keihan Electric Railway had a plan to construct the Nagoya Express Railway, a high-speed railway leading further to Nagoya City, and obtained a license for the project in 1929.
The Keihan Electric Railway had a plan to construct the Nagoya Express Railway, a high-speed railway leading further to Nagoya City, and obtained a license for the project in 1929.

sen.j: だが世界恐慌の影響で京阪本体の経営が危うくなったことから、このような計画は実現不可能となり、1935年に免許が失効した。
sen.e: However, the Keihan Electric Railway came to be in financial difficulty due to the Great Depression, and thus it became impossible to carry out the plan, thereby losing the license in 1935.
However, the Keihan Electric Railway entered a period of financial difficulty due to the Great Depression; thus it became impossible to carry out the plan, and the license expired in 1935.
However, the Keihan Electric Railway entered a period of financial difficulty due to the Great Depression; thus it became impossible to carry out the plan, and the license expired in 1935.

sen.j: この駅のホームが広いのは、その分岐線計画を考慮して設計されたからである。
sen.e: The platforms at this station are wide because they were designed taking into account the plan of a branch line.
The platforms at this station are wide because they were designed in consideration of the plan for a branch line.
The platforms at this station are wide because they were designed in consideration of the plan for a branch line.
